description.narrative:
MERN has been in the forefront of promoting mangrove governance. It has introduced a model governance: joint activity between community and local forestry department for effective mangrove and biodiversity conservation for climate change which it hopes to replicate in other areas.
Also, MERN has been partnering with George Washington University in USA and has trained 40 government staff from 10 government agencies to increase their understanding of climate change issues and to learn how climate change mainstreaming could be done in respected ministries.
For this project, there are two expected outcomes: - An exit strategy is developed -At least 5 people (both CSO and government staff) develop understanding and skills around climate change.

participating-org.narrative:
Created in August 2009 by 17 Myanmar NGOs, the Mangrove Environmental Rehabilitation Network emerged out of civil society recognition that an enabling environment is a precondition to bring about environmental sustainability. It is not surprising then that this first network of Myanmar civil society has its beginnings from Cyclone Nargis that hit the southern part of the country in May 2008.Network members include a wide range of stakeholders such as government departments, businessmen, professional institutions and community based organizations. Ecodev - a partner of ON in the cyclone Nargis response in 2008- is the secretariat of this network.
Overall, MERN hopes to build the base to contribute towards environmental sustainability and enriched biodiversity of the country ingeneral. This according to MERN can not be done in isolation from the active participation of key stakeholders: communities, CSOs/CBOs, and local government officials. In so doing, MERN hopes to create an enabling environment for management of mangrove ecosystem and in the process, generating greater sense of ownership and shared responsibility for livelihood protection and socio-economic well being, from below.
Myanmar Environment Rehabilitation- Conservation Network - Humanitarian
